text: Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.
Light amber with off white head - Smoked malt aroma - Smoked malt body - Smoked malt goes into the finish - This was nice

24/IX/16 - on tap @ Borefts Bier Festival - BB: n/a (2016-1177) Thanks to the Belgian ratebeer crew for sharing todays beers!
Clear amber beer, creamy off-white head, pretty stable, adhesive, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: pretty smoky, malty, grains, dried fruits, some prunes. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: very smoky start, camp fire in your mouth, bitter. Aftertaste: smoky, sweet malts, caramel, bit hoppy, more smoke, spicy lingering bitterness in the end.
Bue à la pression au Borefts Beer Festival 2016. Javais dautres choses à faire que de prendre des notes ;)
Sample at Borefts 2016. Amber beer, small head. Aroma is juniper, medicinal. Taste is the same, tastes bit like coughsyrup

Sweet smokey malts, some caramel and toffee, notes of juniper and spices and herbs into the finish.

Draught at Borefts Beer Festival 2016.
Clear orange coloured with a small off-white ehad.
Fruity aroma of caramel, peat and smoke.
Fruity flavour of caramel, peat and smoke.
Spicy finish.Earlier Rating: 11/3/2009 Total Score: 3.2Draught at 1st Borefts Beer Festival at De Molen.
Cloudy red brown coloured with a medium sized beige head.
Smoked aroma of burnt wood and peat.
Smoked flavour of burnt wood, fruits, hops and grass.
Smoked finish.
Too much smoke for me.
At BBF, clear light copper color, mellow smokey aroma, a bit charred, darkish bread and light caramel, flavor of nuts, smoke and caramel, sweetness in the back with a hint of sourness. Very nice.

Splendida birra dal colore ambra rossastro e schiuma beige. Al naso bella affumicata e continua al palato con questo malto affumicato ottimo, non è stancante e si beve ala grande. Anche il grado alcolico sostiene bene la bevuta, si avverte già al naso e accompagna alla grande.

How: Bottle.
Where: Systembolaget.
Appearance: Amber colour with an off-white head.
Aroma: Smoked, juniper, malt, spices, some fruit.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Caramel, spices, juniper, malt.
van de tap op borefts 2016. Amber met een creme kraag. gedroogd fruit, abrikoos tabak en gist iets kruidig. Ik mag dit graag drinken.

From tap at Borefts 2016. Aroma is sweetish smoked malts, big smoke, touch of fruits and toffee. Did not get much juniper. Flavour is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Body is medium. A bit Rauchbier-like, though thats probably a blasphemic statement. Anyway, its good.
Tap. Clear copper color with eggshell head. Aroma is smoked ham, woodfire, juniper. Taste is smoked, juniper, quite jammy. Smoky finish. Low carbonation. Delicious!

Sampled from tap at Borefts 2016 day 2. Clear dark golden with creme head. Big smokey resin, pine, caramel, fudge toffee. Medium sweet and ashy bitter. Medium body and low carbonation big sweet smokey pine resiny finish. Nice.

Tap at Borefts. Clear very deep golden with off white head. Massive smoke, goat droppings, hay, juniper, peat, dead leaves, sweet malts, caramel, herbs. Over medium sweet and smoky bitterness. Over medium bodied.

Borefts 2016
Goeie rook... achterin wat kruiden die mijn keel niet dult... later gaat t beter

Draft sample @ Haand fest 16, Drammen. Shared with the Norwegian tasting crew.
Cuivrée, col fin crémeux blanc-cassé.
Arôme au nez bisé, fumé, touche de baies de genévrier qui complète le tout, restant dans un style tout à fait Narke.
Palais est malté, pâle, pointe de fumé, juniper berries, avec un côté de bouleau/boisé birch wood et léger fumé. Le tout fonctionne bien sans être trop surfait, petite amertume en fin de bouche tout en gardant un côté tourbé. Apparemment un style usant de genévrier et de miel.
50 cl bottle from systembolaget. Pours amber red with little head. Smokey aroma with smokey malty, winey taste.

Tap at Borefts Beer Festival 2014. Pours a nice, dark, reddish amber with an off white, nice head. Looks great. Aroma is smokey leather, shoes, sweat, peat and some caramel sweetness. Taste is sweet, toasted, sugary caramel at first, but then turns ugly, leathery peat, smoke, meat. Medium carbonation and medium body. Not my style!
220115. Tap at Nordic, Tampere. Pours clear reddish amber with a small head. Aroma smoke, berries malts. 	A bit weird. Not Bad.
Tap @ Nordic. Pours hazy reddish brown, beige head. Sour, leathery, juniper, smoke, wood aroma. Smoke, tart, woody, ripe fruits flavor.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Red amber, light hazy. Soft smokey, horsey malty nose. Pretty interesting, makes me really think about stables, horsedung and all that. Med bodied, sour berries, an overripe apple- like fruityness, yeast, more stables, dung and all that. Finishes on a slight herbal grassy note. Interesting. Really exotic flavours, pulls nice for one pint, at least. A bit like that beaver ass-gland- one they had.
Clear amber colour, beige head. Smoky aroma, malts, juniper. Sweet malty flavour, bit herbal. Smoky finish. Nice!(from draught @ CBC blue session, Copenhagen 2014)
Clear brown. Very smokey, woody, herbal aroma. Flavour is very floral and herbal. Smooth, slightly sticky and very strange.
Tap at BBF14. Pours red brown amber with a tiny head. Beer is ruled one-sidedly by the peat. Not bad, but not balanced.
I love the smoke in this beer, its right in your face and tastes a whole lot like smoked raindeer.

UPDATED: DEC 29, 2014 Sampled at Borefts Beer Festival 2014. THX everyone for sharing todays beers.
Amber beer. Nose is completely smoked/peated. Taste is the same. Completely unbalanced for me
Shared sample at bbf. Poured a clear dark amber colour. Lot of smoke, spice, iodine, sweet caramel, pear, blegh

Tap @ BBF 14. Pours copper with a beige head. Aroma is very smoked, lots of whiskey notes and peat. some caramel notes behind as well. Taste... Oh no. Smoke is everywhere. Peat is everywhere. Where is the beer? There is some marinated meat in here as well. This was not me unfortunately.
@ Borefts Bierfestival 2014. Dark amber colour. Medium carbonation. Aroma of spices (juniper) and peat. Well balanced. Light sweet with bitter smoky finish. Nice!

@Borefts 2014, caramel met lichte kaki kraag. aroma is hoppig, caramel, iets rokerigs van de mouten. Smaken zijn matig zoet, caramel, rookmout, komt wat weeïg binnen. afdronk licht rookmout smaken, caramel, toch aardig bier..

At BBF14 . 
Pours clear dark, redbrown . 
No real head . Smell is peat . Taste is peat, pure peat . Very straight peat , very bad
sampled @ Borefts Beer Festival 2014: dunkel orangebraunes Bier mit ordentlicher weißer Schaumkrone. Geruch nach Torf, Kräuter, malzig, so ist auch der Geschmack .

Draught at Borefts 14. Pale amber with a small off-white head. Medium to full body with low carbonation. Medium sweetness, smoke, spiciness and bitterness. Smoke, roasted malts, peat, juniper and herbs. A nice full flavoured smokey experience.
On tap at Borefts. Hazy red-amber, lacy head. Smoke and herbs in aroma. Sweet and smoky flavor. medium body. Long dried fruit finish.
Grumlig, brun-orange med brun-orange skum. Doft: Rökig korv, malt, skogs jord, lite nybakat bröd. Smak: Rökig korv, trä, hårt gräddat knäckebröd, lite av röda övermogna äpplen.

Tap at CBC 2014. Beer in the glass brownish-copper coloured. Nice head. Heavy malty, light smokey aroma. Starts soft-malty, a bit smokey, some woody notes. Finish well balanced, soft-malty. Really nice!

Keg at the Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014, blue session. 02/05/2014. Rich red / caramel coloured pour with a halo off white head. Aroma is big on the msoked malt, tcp, phenols. Flavour is sweet peat smoked malt, medicinal smoked malts, tcp phenols. Too much.

Sample @ CBC 2014. Pours amber with a off-white head. Aroma is peat, juniper, caramel and earthy. Taste is medium sweet, smokey and spicy bitterness. Medium bodied and soft carbonation, easy drinkable.

Draught at CBC 2014. Clear copper liquid with a small off-white head. Aroma of smoke, juniper, ham, wood and malt. Taste is light sweet and light bitter with notes of smoke and toffee. Medium bodied with low carbonation. Great.
On tap at CBC 2014. Brown with off white head. Aroma and taste of caramel, smoke, jam, juniper, more smoke, earth, herbs. Not my cup of T.
CBC. Clear brown with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and peated. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet finish. 020514

Jam, smoke, juniper, slightly spicy. Hazy ruby colour, medium beige head, lacing. Smokey and sweet flavour, jam, earthy hops, low bite. Medium body, soft carbonation, long smokey and warming finish. Very interesting beer.
Tap @ CBC, 14. Dark brown with small tan head. Aroma is malt, caramel, peat, smoke and ash. Flavour is malt, peat, smoke, medium sweet, little bitter, caramel, dark fruit and toasted.

Draught @ CBC2014. Pours clear amber with a thick and lasting beige head. Aroma is caramel, berries, juniper, fat smoke, earthy and hops. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is moderate. Taste is near heavy sweet and bitter. Finishes dry and bitter with lingering smoke and juniper.

Draught sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014. 2nd Session. Pours red to brown with a beige head, aroma is smoked, woody smokiness, some peat, flavor of wood, malt, peat, smoked wood, smoked fish, medium bodied.
Draught at CBC 2014. Dark brown colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of fruit, hops, malt, caramel, oak smoke.

[5/2/14] Draught sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration. 2nd session. Deep reddish amber. Aroma of smoked wood, malt, caramel and light fruitiness. Sweetish flavor with malt, caramel, nice smokiness and a drier finish. Medium-bodied.

Draught @ CBC 2014. Pours brown with a offwhite head, lacings. Aroma of malt, smoke, wood, berries, caramel light fruit. Flavor is malt, wood, berries, wood, caramel, meaty smoke, fruity hops. Medium body, soft carbonation. 020514

Draught at CBC 2014. Pours a clear red-brown color with a small off-white head. The taste is a simple malty affair with flavours of lighter fruits and hops. The hops sticks around for a while in the aftertaste. Medium body and carbonation. Not bad.

Sample from tap, CBC 2014. Hazy, orange-brown with a lasting, lightly tanned head. Fruity aroma with smoke, wood, sweet fruits, caramel malts and juniper berries. Taste is sweet and smoked. Medium to full body with an oily texture. Finishes sweet and smoked with juniper berries. A wooden note. Very special.

Pours deep red amber with low off-white head. Aroma of peats, and peats. Taste is balanced sweet with heavy peats and smoke. Body is liggt to medium with soft carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Kobber skum råhvid s
Røg malt tømmer ask tøv
Bitter modrate sød lidt 
Blød 
@cbc

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Keg at Ma Che, Roma, 11/02/14.
Almost clear copper come amber with a good sized light beige head.
Nose is smoked malt, peaty tones, earthy, toffee, smoke dominates.
Taste comprises smoked malt, smoked meats, peat, toffee, grain.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying smoked infused close.
All about the smoke which it carries off pretty well for me - no for the rausch newbie!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
Bottle (shared w/brewer at Gaenstaller).
Head is initially small, frothy, off-white, mostly diminishing.
Body is hazy medium amber.
Aroma is lightly to moderately malty (cookie, caramel, toasted bread), with notes of apricot, smoke, candy/brown sugar.
Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly to moderately bitter.
Medium body, velvety/creamy texture, lively carbonation, lightly alcoholic.
Really delicious stuff, well-balanced and super clean. Nice interplay of smoke and fruit and cookies etc. Hope to have a whole bottle to myself someday.

Bottle shared by H.G. at the Zoiglstube. The smoked malt on first whiff seems peat-like but further passes show its more reserved and meaty and the juniper gives it a quiet herb and twig and forest rain character. Creamy, soft carbonation, very clean throughout, malt is soft and supportive. Lingering mild juniper spice in the finish with an exceptionally rich meat and peat smoke quality. Low sweetness with a beefy full body and rich frothiness. Truly remarkable flavor expression and balance.

Tap sample @ Haand Festival 2013. Orange-brown hazy "sunset" body with a medium off-white head - this beer looks stunning! :-) Aroma is smoke, honey, forest, moss, hints of wood and juniper twigs. Taste is honey, wood, grass, moss, dark caramelly malts, grains, hints of syrup and herbs. Really nice. Full body, medium carbonation. Original and great stuff.

Medium beige head. Hazy red-brown body. Syrupy campfire smoke aroma with earthy funky notes. Sweet-dryish pine needle and syrup taste with smoky funky barnyard notes. Mid-bodied. Mild, soft mouthfeel. Dryish medicinal lingonberry afteraste with strong sheep barn and pine needle notes. Nice and drinkable. (0.15l draft at Haand 13.)

On tap @ Borefts 2012. Amber-plum colored in the glass with a heavy lacing off-white head. The aroma has a swift of smoke over it with sweet ham and nuts. Quite enjoyable even though its not extreme in any way. In the taste it has a red-sour berry flavor with smoke and a sugary sweetness. Quite tasty. Ends light astringent and mouthdrying. 30.09.2012

Draught @ Haand Ølfestival 2013
Pours clear deep amber with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, peat, caramel and floral. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long caramel and peated finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
On tap at Haand 2013. Pours hazy brown with a small creamy off-white head. Aroma is smoke, peat and some malts. Taste is light sweet malty, plenty of tar and smoke presence. Medium bodied.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 29.09.2012, tap @ Borefts:
Lett sødmerik og røykt lukt med preg av lettrøykt malt, humle, fjøs, karamell, lettrøykt skinke, gras. Frisk lett tørr smak med preg av malt, humle, tre, karamell, røykt skinke, gras, høy. God bitterhet som set litt. Grei.

Sampled from tap at Haandøl 2013. Nose reminiscent of a matchbox with mixed used and new matchsticks. Mouth is pungent smokey acidic and sweet with pleasant vanilla notes. Full bodied, dry tongue. Clar orange colored body with a light brown film.

Backlog. On tap @ BBF 2009 (and some later @ In De Wildeman). Red-brown bolor. Not much head. Aromas: smoked, herbal (juniper), with a light acidity retronasal. Flavor is smoky, medium bitter. Body is medium. Long finish, bitter & herbal. Interesting.

0.15 @ Haand. Red, brown colour with a offwhite medium head. Smoked with hints of pinefur and caramel. Ash smoke taste, quite bitter. Lasting aftertaste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

17-MAY-2013, draft @Mikkeller Bar with Ulkløbben.
Clear amber with low off-white head.
Salami aroma. Charred wood, sweet malt, and bread.
Taste too smokey again in a meaty sausage way. Well made beer but not my type. Too smokey but an nice bock may lure underneath?

On tap at Mikkeller Bar, pours a deep dark orangey amber with a small beige head. Aroma of peaty malt, and toasted nuts -- very subtle. Flavour of smoked malt, toasted nuts, and musty earthy notes. Another very smoky one from Narke and not very elegant. Decent stuff.
(Short review due to the massive amounts of beer I drank during the CBC13.) Interesting. Tap at mikkeller bar

Tap @ Mikkeller.
Pours hazy copper color with a small head. Aroma of ripe fruits, whisky notes, caramel and malts. Flavour is the same with some berries and smoke. Quite sweet and woody. Odd.
5324

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Pours a hazy murky amber colour. Aroma of smoked meat, strong malts and grass. Flavour of peat, smoked malts and grass. Full bodied, oily mouthfeel. Warming and peaty doppelbock.

Draught @ Ölrepubliken. Pours hazy deep dark brown with a creamy and frothy beige head that slowly dissipates while leaving a thick lacing on the glass. Smell is subtle, slightly sweet and malty with bread, smoke, peat, wood, caramel, biscuits, cereal, lemon zest and hints of pine needles. Taste is sweet, tiny bitter, tiny sour and malty with sweet dark bread, caramel, lemon juice, plums, wood, biscuits, pine needles, cookie dough, peat, smoke and hints of pine needles and juniper berries. Mouthfeel is smooth, round, tiny tart and medium bodied. Finish is tiny sweet, slightly bitter and tiny sour with sweet dark bread, peat, wood, smoke, lemon juice and cereal. Nice and balanced.
@Gothenburg beer and whiskey festival. Hazy Dark amber. Smells of stables, sweet. I taste sweetness, som darker smoky notes.
@BBF12. Pours dark amber with a white head. Aroma is caramel, smoke, fruit and light pine. Flavour is caramel, smoke, dried fruit and light pine.
Poured hazy, with an amber color and a small tan head. Fruity, smokey aroma with hints of forest berries and honey. Well balanced bitter finish with a fruity aftertaste.

Sample at Borefts Beer Festival 2012. Pours a clear and dark copper beer with a weak white head. The aroma is malt, weak smoke and weak peat. The flavor follows the nose. The palate is smoke. Overall a beer below average, and out of balance.

Somewhat clean copper body with creamy beige head. Dry hops, dough, twigs, carton (but not in a bad way) and a nice rich yet not punchy smokey base. Light smokey taste as well. Its just not my kind of thing. (75cl bottle at Deansos tasting)

Bottle at a Den Haag RB tasting. Poured reddish brown with a big frothy off white head. A rich smoky aroma but not overpowering. The flavour is smoky woody malty with coffee and spicy liqourice on the palate. A truly hand crafted ale.

Bottle. Dark cola with a tanned head. Very nice balanced smoke aroma alongside with woody notes and a nice malty backbone. Flavor is bittersweet with a lot of smoke present. The balance in this beer is amazing. Medium bodied and carbo. Great!

75cl bottle courtesy of Denk.
Thin white head.  Amber clear pour.  Smokey taste.  Nice brew.

Tap @ SMÖF 2012. Pours clear amber brown with a small tanned head. Aroma is smokey sweet acidy malty salty acidy and a bit fruity. Flavor is sweet smokey acidy, like sousage and bitter. Finishes bitter acidy.
Sampled at SMÖF 2012. Pours dark copper with a small light brown head. Smells and tastes smoked meat with a smoked meat bitter finish.
Tap at Haand Festival 2012. Clear amber body, low beige head. Aroma of smoke, malt, leather. Taste of sweet malt. juniper, wood, and light smoke, which last into aftertaste.

Draught @ Borefts 12. Slightly unclear copper color, small to medium sized a bit creamy off-white head. Smell malts and heavely peated or smoked or both, almost like fingerpaint I used as a kid. Damn I hate that smell. Taste is slightly better, but here also the fingerpaint-resembling peat / smoke comes through. Low to medium body, medium carbonation. Not my thing at all.

Tap @ Borefts 2012. The pours deep amber with a small head. The nose is smoked ham, soft honey comb, smooth dark malt flavors and dried wood. The taste is more smokey ham, charred wood. Delicate herbal hop burn on the finish. Very smooth, nicely executed. Not my favorite collection of flavors (smoke), but good for what it is.

On tap at Borefts 2012, Bodegraven. Pours clear, ruby-gold with a fine, off-white cream head. Nicely rounded smoke aroma. Medium sweet flavor with a bit of dry caramel, pleasant smoke, faint honey-cured ham. Medium bodied with fine to average carbonation. Good, balanced finish, some toasty bread, rich smoke, a bit more ham. Quite nice.

Draft at Borefts. Clear amber color, small tan head. Aoma of light
Y burnt toast and dark fruit. Taste is slightly sour prunes. Interesting.
Tap at Boreft Beer Festival 12, Bodegraven: Clear amber/red coloured brew named after the goats of the god of thunder, Thor. Smokey taste and hints of fruits.

Draft @ Borefts 2012. Very ruby amber and a head that looks like milk with coffee. Nose is that of clean charcoal, defined sharper smoke, leather and some almost peated smoke in there.Taste is moderate easier smoke, leather, some tad sweeter darker malts, cleaner fresh-made charcoal, some mild berries, light touch of clean sourness. Medium bodied. This feels like a porter-like beer they probably made way back - what a take back from the description this is a doppelbock. Närke does appear to hark back to traditions which I do like. Probably lovelier to just drink as well than to just have a tasting glass of this.

Not a big fan of smoked beers. But more moderated smoked at taste as smell. Amber coloured with an ok head.
Smoked, hops, biterness with slightly sour and sweetness.

Bottle at the Bushops Arms, Malmo.  Pours clear amber brown with a tiny ring tan head.  Aroma of smoke, leather, dark fruit and damp.  Flavour is light to medium sweet and bitter, light smokey and slight watery.  You would never know its 7.5%!  Medium bodied with moderate carbonation.  A very nice smoke beer from a fantastic brewery.
Smak av läder, malt. Rätt så stor sötma som räddas upp av beskan och gör det hela balanserat.
30th September 2009On tap at Borefts I. Very slightly hazy amber beer. Light smoke on a crisp palate. A little fruit and malt coming through before the minerally finish which is also dry. Decent.

24/05/2012 Ma che siete venuti a fà (tap). Ambrata, lievemente torbida, schiuma crespa poco abbondante e persistente. Al naso affumicato abbastanza deciso, note dolciastre maltate, luppolo poco percettibile. In bocca ha un attacco dolce, maltato, con un bellaffumicato abbastanza lungo. Corpo consistente, carbonazione medio-bassa. Come birra è molto interessante, ma secondo me ha un corpo e una nota di malto lievemente eccessivi.

Tap @ Haand festival.
Pour reddish/brownish, with no head.
Aroma i a little smokey of leather, malty caramel. 
Taste sweet, with a well balanced bitter aftertaste. 
Average body, with a slight fizzy carb.
On tap @Macche. It recalls me the taste of a barley wine, to be honest. Bright red colour, medium persistence froth. The malt taste is very present. Strong enough. Medium carbonation. Good job!

On tap at HaandBryggeriet Beer Festival, Drammen. Deep orange to red colour, low head. Strong aroma of peat smoke and juniper smoke. The flavour is dominated by peat smoke and juniper smoke throughout. One-dimensional, not my cup of tea.

On tap @ Haand2012. Pours amber with a creamy beige head. Aroma of smoke, berries, some malt and fruitiness. Flavor is sweet smoked malt with some red berries and wood. Medium body, average carbonation. Nice smoked beer.
Lite lade back rökighet, fin frisk smak och en trevlig fyllighet. En helt ok öl, men jag har glömt den ganska snabbt.
On tap. Pours an almost clear amber with an off-white head. Thick and greasy Bamberg-style smoke aroma. Medium body, sweet caramel but completely dominated by the smoke. Lightly bitter finish. 200412

Cask, småbryggeriernas beer festival, Malmö. Another strange experiment beer from Närke. Sweetness from the malts and a little bitterness. So far a double bock. Lots of leather, sligthly smoky, maybe a bit thin but lots of tastes that comes together nicely.

Draught at Stockholm Beer Festival:
Aroma and taste of smoke, leather, sweaty horse, dung and manure. One among the most disgusting beer Ive tasted! Pretty much in the same character as "Närke Bäver".

Gotlandsdricke!  Its been a while since Ive had one of these.  Amber and slightly hazy.  The aroma is heavily smoked with rich caramel.  Has a richly smoked character, flat and a little bit phenolic as one would expect from the style.  Interesting, a good example of this rare style.

Billy Ross just pulled this out and shared it at our pre-hunahpus tasting.  Wow! Amber/brown pour.  Nice smoke aroma with some toffee background notes.  Flavor is charred oak, smoke, caramel.  Very nice.
Quite the smoked beer here. Like licking a piece of charred wood but is good way. Definitely not for the tame of heart. Light body, pale copper. Smoke fades and doesnt linger to clean up nicely.

Growler shared by Billy Ross at the pre-Huny tasting.  Clear brown pour with a small off white head.  Huge smokey nose.  The smoke is much more muted in the taste with a big caramel malt backbone.  Medium in body with good carbonation.  Nice...

Bottle at CCB tasting party. Copper brown. Amazingly fun bandaid smoke. Smooth smoky campfire smoked malt tastes very primitive in a good way. Nothing wrong with it. If you like smoke and leather, with a hint of bandaid with some nice malt sugars carrying the body...why not? Fun stuff!

On tap at The Avenue Pub. Pours a cloudy copper with a small off white head leaving spotty lacing. The aroma is pepper and rubber. Medium mouthfeel with a bitter dry finish. Alcohol present. A decent traditional ale.

1/21/12. On tap. Cloudy amber pour with a small ring of khaki head. Smokey, almost plasticky aroma with a bit of caramel. Sweet caramel entry followed by more smoke and burnt plastic... a touch of juniper maybe. Odd.

(Draught) Pours hazy reddish Brown with à small head. The aroma is glest malty with smoke, nuts, dark bread and dark caramel. Touch of dried fruits, minerals/wet stone and woodsy, earthy hops. The flavour is light to medium sweet, light to medium bitter and tiny acidic. Tones of smoke, caramel, cookies, light dried fruits, dark bread, resin, earth, ash and earth. The mouthfeel is round  and fairly soft witha near medium carbonation. Smokey and earthy finish. Medium bodied.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Hunters
Deep ruby color, small off-white head. Wet wood, smoke, tar, caramel malts and chocolate in the nose. Medium-bodied. Starts smokey and tarry, finish has some bitterness. Some alcohol in the aftertaste. Malt profile is caramel-chocolaty. Good Närke-quality.

Draught.
Described as a lager in the brewers text, but still categorized as an ale?
Anyway, it pours a deep copper, with a beige head.
Smokey, malty aromas, caramel, licorice, meat, pepper, spices.
Off-dry, medium to full body, medium bitterness, balanced CO2.
SMokey taste, cured meats, malt, peppar, caramel, leather, tobacco. Odd, but very well made. (2011-10-28)

Aromatisch rauchig-holziger Antrunk, deutliche Eichenaromen springen einem entgegen. Röstmalzig, etwas schokoladig, sehr harmonisch. Die Rauchigkeit, obwohl sehr präsent, wirkt weniger intensiv, da es sich mit den anderen Aromen verbindt. Herb, rauchig, süßlich sowie hopfig zum Schluss, das Bier wird intensiver. Leichte Tannenaromen veredeln den Nachgeschmack. /10/11/12//11

I had this from the bottle into a Närke glass at the brewery with Hans.

The beer pours a medium copper with light orange highlights, semi clear. There is a medium tan head ok retention and lacing....The aroma is light smoke throughout with lots of herbs. Juniper water was used so I can smell that with a couple other smells I cant identify...The tasty is very herby but the smoke cuts it down and makes it drinkable. 

Not my kind of beer with lots of herbs but the smoke makes it interesting and worth a shot especially if you are Swedish as it is a traditional Gotlandick beer dating back 3500 years.

Draught. Hazy orange brown with a nice big dirty orange head that leaves nice lacings. Aroma is smoky whisky, some fruit, brew mash and juniper. It smells a bit like Gotlandsdricka. Taste is malty and smoky with juniper and some caramel. Once again it reminds me a bit of gotlandsdricka. Body is good and the mouthfeel is oily. Very special.

Sampled at SBWF-10
Hazy, deep amber.
Leather and smoked.
Juniper-berries and blueberries.

(Draught at Pikkulintu) The beer poured ruby red and almost clear. Its head was small and white. Aroma had strong smokiness and quite lot of molasses and malts. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. The flavours I found were malts, smoke, molasses, roastedness and low bitterness. I thought no hops were used but based on the commercial description I was wrong. Nice and interesting brew.

Draught @ Pikkulintu, Helsinki

Pours orange with light white head. Aroma has hints of leather. Taste has a bit of smoke, sahti and malts. A bit unbalanced.

Draught. Dark brown with a medium-sized off-white head. Aroma: mostly smoke, some smoked meat. Taste: malt, smoke, berries, some dried fruits, some acidity, medium bitterness. Quite a full mouthfeel. A really tasty, different, and interesting beer with a good smokiness that isnt too meaty.
Sample @ SBWF 10. Hazy amber. Smoke, perfume and fruit in aroma. More of the same in the rich taste but with some coffee added. Despite the smoke its still refreshing. Nice.

Draught at The Rover, on November 9, 2010Hazy brown color, lasting off-white head. Cream, strawberry, fresh, smooth taste. Smooth mouthfeel, low bitterness. Mainly smoked malt scent, though not extreme. Some smoked aftertaste, or more.Very nice.
SBWF 2010. Amber color, offwhite head. Smokt aroma, sweetish, leather, woody notes. Smoky sweetish flavor, leather, pine, woody notes.
On tap at Mikkeller. Pours a clear amber. Smells of leather. Sweet with aromas of caramel malts and some leather. Soft carbonation. Medium bodied. Dry finish. Fresh.

Draught at Stockholm Beer Festival 2010. Hazy reddish brown color. Thick eathy smoke aroma. Pungent barnyardy and earthy smoke flavor with sweet malty toffeish backbone. The smoke character is here is very weird and pungent, perverse I would say.
Has an aroma of smoked meat and burning wood. The taste also brings about notions of a camp fire. Mouthfeel is very pleasant and refreshening. Aftertaste is complex, smokey and woody.
Draught at Stockholm Beer Festival:Pours a dark brown, hazy colour with a large head. "Aroma" is manure and leather. Flavour is all leather: it tastes like a leather bag!!
On tap at Mikkeller bar. Red orange colour with an off-white head. Aroma is dry, fruit, smoked, caramel, malt. Flavour is dry, malt, smoked, fruit, caramel. Nice beer.

On tap at Mikkeller. Its a slightly hazy, reddish golden beer topped by a small, off-white head. Lots of smoke and horse droppings. Some faint caramel. Maybe that sound bad, but it was quite nice. The flavor has smoked malts giving bacon and some ham, and a little horse droppings touch and a fine bitterness. Full body. A strange beer, but quite nice even though it wakes what seems like unpleasant associations. 100506

Draft @ Bishops Arms, Malmö. Pours a slightly hazy amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty smoky aroma with hints of caramel. Sweetish malty caramel flavor with some smoky hints and some hints of hops. Has a sweetish malty smoky caramel finish.

Draft. A hazy golden beer with a thin orangey head. The aroma has strong notes of smoke as well as medium notes whiskey, wood, and peat. The flavor is sweet malty with strong notes of peated smoke as well as medium notes of wood and whiskey, leading to a sligtly tart finish.

From [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Bar. Virtually no head. Body is dark amber with good clarity. 
Distinct malt aroma, smokey and tarry. Also a scent of sour berries. Clean malt flavor, fairly dry with a fine smoke accent. Notes of cigarbox and charcoal. Medium bitterness. Surprisingly light in body.  Smokey malt linger in the end.  Very interesting, very good.

Medium brown colour . Has a light brown head, mostly diminishing. Aroma is malty, sweet and has soft notes of smoke. Flavor is moderate sweet. Salty. Long duration. Dry, oily texture. Soft carbonation.

Draught @ Mikkeller bar. DArk amber coloured. Light beige head. Smoke, sweetness, earth and some herbs in the aroma. Flavour a bit barnyardy and earthy. Again smoke and sweetness is there and some spice. Meidum bodied. Has a light sourness and a smoky edge in the end.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Bar. Rubyish amber colour, small white head. Aroma is bigtime leathery with some sweet malts, mild alcohol and some slight smoked notes. Flavour is juniper, bigtime leathery and smoked notes with some alcohol and malts giving it a nice body. Nice interpretation of a doppelbock.
Draught at Mikkeller Bar. Clear and deep red-brown body. Shinning surface. Smoked malty aroma. Ditto taste with spices. Finish is dry and bittersweet. Medium bodied (Copenhagen, 08.05.2010).
Amber with a small white head. Aroma of smoke and malt with a hint of something leather-like. Dry and malty flavour with peat notes.
Draught (Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen) - Brown with a haze. Smoky and vinous aroma with hints of caramel. Smoky taste with dried fruit and spicy malt.

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Pours unclear dark amber with a small bubbly head .Nose is smoke, caramel and leather. Flavor has a bit tar, leather and caramel. Medium bodied. Quite tasty. Some warmth from alcohol.

On tap @ Mikkeller bar. Hazy reddish orange with a nice, but diminishing tan head. Aroma is dominated by smoked malt, but there is some kind of berries and fruit as well, a pleasant combination. Flavor is quite sweet, slightly roasted and heavy smoked malt, almost like bonfires with burnt mackerel skin. Nice body, fine balanced and good flavor. Very nice.

tap at mikkeller bar.
cloudy amber, small yellow head.
somewhat fruity, smoked, faint malty, berryish .  in general fruity bitter, add faint sweet malts and smoked notes. ends hoppy bitter and smoked with a hint of fruits.
Tap. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are malt, wood, smoke, hops and flowers.
Draught. Creamy white good mostly alsting head. Amber colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter smoked flavor. Average moderate bitter finish. Oily palate.

From tap at MikkkellerBAR. Pours hazy dark orange with a small off-white head. Aroma is yeasty and slight fruity. Hops peachy. Solid hoppy, citrusy, grapefruit and slight peachy. Bone dry and fruity into the finish. Way to carbonated. Lasting rather brutal bitterness into the far finish.

MIkkeller bar.
Tap. Clear amber colour with okay head, Smoked aroma and flavour is smoked ofc. Some sweetness.

Draught at MikkellerBAR. 
Nice, smokey, roasted, berries, sweetness, light nutty, light dryness, rubber, nice, a bit light.

Draught at The 1st BBF at De Molen. Pours deep brown colored with a small bubbly light brown head. Aromas of sour smoke, caramel, tar and coffee. Flavors of roasted malt, coffee, fat meaty smoke, caramel and licorice. Hmm.. Tasty? Well i guess it is..

Draught at Beerexpo 2010 in Linköping. Red and litte hazy body. Aroma has some smoke, bread and hops.
Flavor also has some smoke, sweet malty and some hops showing through. Medium body.

On tap at Akkurat. (2 Feb 2010)

Dark red-brown color with a white head.

Interesting aroma of smoke, malt, juniper, cookies. Also some coffee and fruit. 

The taste contained smoke, ash, orange, licorice, salt, spices and some hops. A different and good beer. Im glad I tried it.

(Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm, 29 Aug 2010) Dark brown colour, slightly hazy, with foamy beige head. Malty, smoky nose with juniper twigs, old socks and a slightly petrochemical hint of garage and motor oil. Malty, smoky taste with notes of burning juniper twigs, dried fruit, citrus and earthy hops in the finish. A bit weird but grows as the initial petrochemical touch settles and gives way for the smoked malt and fresh hop character. Almost full body. Not really a beer to start the evening with, but if you wait too long there is a certain risk you wont be able to order it by its name. Interesting beer, and quite nice.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Dark red color, creamy white head. Aroma is sweet (caramel), smokey and spicy (juniper and fertilizer!). The taste is as complex as the aroma. Caramel, small sourness, smoke, lingonberry, orange and fat hops. Medium bodied.

Draught at Akkurat.

Pours red orange with a creamy head.

Taste of oranges, not the cest but the fruit meat, lingonberries and some  smoke.

A very special and complex beer!

Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm. Pours out in a hazy reddish amber colour with a rich white foam. Rich aroma of smoke, juniper, seaweed and licorice with hints of honey and cookies. Medium-bodied with notes of juniper, smoke, tar, rye, honey and licorice, hints of cookies, herbs and and crystallized sugar. Firm body. Long finish of juniper, smoke and salt. Tasty and unique.

Draught @ Borefts Beer Festival 2009 - De Molen.Clear medium to dark amber color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roated, smoke - meat - ashtray, berry - juniper notes. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20091030]

UPDATED: SEP 24, 2016 Bottle at De Molen Event 2009 ...  amber ... smoky woodynose ... odd fruit ... rich ... deep bitterness ... i didnt take good notes as the Brewer was very kindly telling me all about the beer... tasty though.
Keg at borefts 2016 day 2  as 8.2... Deep red.. Light smokey floral fruit nose.. Soft sweet toffee malts.. Light floral smok 3.4

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2012 On tap @ In de Wildeman, light brown colour, slightly hazy with foamy, long  lasting head. Aroma full of smoke, slight coffee hint. Long lasting taste of smokey oak with hint of coffee. Wicked beer.

Draught at In de Wildeman, Amsterdam. Pours a clear copper color with a decent creamy off white head. Very spicy aroma with citrus, pepper, camomile and smoke. Flavor is complex with a prominent spicy bitterness throughout. Nice taste evolution to a dry bitter fruity finish. Medium carbonation. Very nice beer.

From draught at SMÖF. 
Copper colour with low head. Elegant smoke and juniper in aroma. Smokey backbone in flavour with with rounded mouthfeel. First ashes, then smoke, then ashes again in a clean, less fruity body. A bit of house character was sensed I believe, in terms of dark plum. Pretty light bodied and a fair bitterness was sensed. Great beer.

Tasted at the first, great, Borefts Beer Festival 2009 @ De Molen. Very nice story from the brewers about the origin of this beer. Amber, brown colored brew. Aroma is smoky, juniper, tree. Flavor is also a lot of the whole juniper tree that went in there. Smoke, malty, some hops. Nice brew, great.

On tap at Örebro Öl & Whisky Festival. Pours a nice amber color with a white head. Very nice smoky, juniper twig aroma, also some light hops on a solid bready maltbase. Flavour is really good malty, with nice smoke, juniper, and light hops. Somewhat bitter finish. Medium to fullbodied. Very tasty and a fun experiment, more of this please!

Draught at Örebro Öl- och Whiskeyfestival.  Clear brownish amber, fairly small head. Gotlandsdricke-like juniper twig aroma. Smokey with near full body and well rounded mouthfeel. The combination of strong juniper twig flavour and smoke makes it flavourwise very close to traditional gotlandsdricke, but the clean flavour profile, probably a result of bottom fermentation, makes it less fruity, estery and rustic. Finishes with slight bitterness. Damn good beer - and very interesting too!

A Mes rate. Draught at 1st Borefts Beer Festival.Amazing red amber colour with a thin but lasting off white head. Full on smoke and ashtray stuff but in the best way. Stunning juniper notes that are not over done at all. All the other juniper beers I have had have been awful, this was the exact opposite. The smoked malt is about the best I have had. Schlenkerla eat your heart out. Seriously. Excellent berry notes in the finish followed by even more smokiness. Its a real love or hate thing clearly, and it doesnt do a great deal but what it has, really hits the spot for me. Really enjoyed talking to the Narke guys about the making of this and the photos of the boiling tree were just hilarious!
It poured a hazy golden liquid with a small yellow foam that left some lacing. Smell of smoke and smoked ham. Smooth mouthfeel. Taste of smoke and smoked ham.

Had this at the Borefts Beer Festival, De Molen Brewery, Bodegraven, Netherlands 30-10-09   Pours amber, this is crystal clear in appearance. There is a thin rim of head. This is nicely smokey, there is a fresh twigginess on the nose. Soft mouthfeel, really lovely, strength well hidden.   A7 A5 F7 P4 Ov14  3.7

Tap at 1st BBF at De Molen. Poured an amber burgundy color with a tan head. Aroma is fruity and provides some malt tones as well. The taste is berry, a bit smokey and bitter at the same time. Nice mouthfeel.

Tap @ 1ste Borefts. A clear orange colored beer, with a beige head. The aroma is fruity of elderberry and juniper berry. there are some malts. The taste is bitter, fruity with some smoke and notes of moss. The aftertaste is bitter and dry.

Tap @ 1st BBF, De Molen.
Pours red brown with a small, film head. Aroma is smokey, some meat character, caramel malts. High carbonation, light dry mouthfeel. Flavour is smokey, sweet caramel, sugary. Light hoppy dryness in the finish. Light smokey aroma, but the flavour is just a little too little of everything.

On tap @ 1st BBF, de Molen. The aroma has smoke, wood and spicy juniper stuff. Red-brown coloured beer with an off-white, lasting head. The taste is bitter, quite smokey and with all the junper berries there. Medium bodied beer. Very interesting and well-brewed.
UPDATED: FEB 6, 2010 Tap @ BBF. Amber color, short head. Aroma of smoke, wood, juniper berries. Dryish taste, malty. Interesting beer, and it gets better while drinking.
On tap at BBF. Amber body with white head. Nose of malts, and some smoke. Taste of berries with nice bitterness to it. Much more mellow than its sisterbrews. Well done.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Very interesting beer. Different from all others with juniper and smoke all over it. Light peaty, light fruity, earthy, nice bitterness. Would love to try this again.

Tap @ 1st BBF De Molen. Very earthy juniperflavor. Mushy, earthy aroma, slightly smoky and tarry. Juniper. Some yeasty notes in the finish. Long earthy mushy bitter aftertaste. A very special brew, not my taste but oozing quality.

On tap at Borefts Bier Festival, De Molen. Amber colour, light off white head. Aroma of peat, iodine, lots of malts. Flavour is malty, salty and smoked, juniper berries, bitter with iodine. Medium bodied. Very nice smoked beer.

On tapp at Bishops Arms Örebro 2009-10-31.
AP: Dark ruby red, light head with a stouty caracter.
AR: Smokey wiskey + maltynes
F. Speyside wiskey, juniper berries, bitternes with that is lasting, had that flavor in my mouth for hours afterwards. Dosent go toghether with food!
